channel.title: How would I go about fixing this?
channel.description:
So a couple of months ago, I purchased a pair of Turtle Beach P11's (It's a wired headset) :D [img]http://images17.newegg.com/is/image/newegg/79-459-004-TS?$S300W$[/img]
But somehow my usb bit of the cable has now ripped, and I'm wondering how to fix it. Here's the bit that ripped off (Images from Google): [img]http://www.cablesdirect.co.uk/write/Images/Products/CDL-012.jpg[/img]
If any more pictures are required, I'd be more than happy to provide. Just want to get this headset fixed!

item.title: How would I go about fixing this?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“PaulT, post:2, topic:548677”]Most USB cables consist of four wires: red, black, white, and green. Some newer cables have eight wires, but the idea is the same. If the USB plug itself is damaged, you’ll need to remove the whole plug and replace it. Otherwise, just the damaged portion of the cable can be removed.

Complete Instructions:
https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/USB+Cable+Repair/12754[/quote]
Thanks, I’ll try this out later today and I’ll let you know how it goes.

EDIT: I tried, ended up with red hands and I guess I’ve done an alright job for my first time
Thanks again for helping PaulT

Read full topic
item.source: How would I go about fixing this?

item.title: How would I go about fixing this?
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Most USB cables consist of four wires: red, black, white, and green. Some newer cables have eight wires, but the idea is the same. If the USB plug itself is damaged, you’ll need to remove the whole plug and replace it. Otherwise, just the damaged portion of the cable can be removed.

Complete Instructions:
https://www.ifixit.com/Guide/USB+Cable+Repair/12754

Read full topic
